text: Asa Briggs, Baron Briggs (7 May 1921 â€“ 15 March 2016) was an English historian. He was a leading specialist on the Victorian era. He was a well- known historian of broadcasting in Britain. He was made a life peer in 1976. Briggs was born in Keighley, West Riding of Yorkshire. Briggs died in Lewes, East Sussex on 15 March 2016. He was aged 94. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2016 deaths Category:English historians Category:Writers from Yorkshire Category:People from West Yorkshire
title: Asa Briggs
